title: U.S. military investing in reentry vehicles for space-to-Earth cargo delivery
summary: Two California-based companies, Inversion Space and Outpost Space, have secured more than $100 million in defense and private investments under the Strategic Funding Increase (STRATFI) program

title: Childhood Snow Days Transformed Linette Boisvert into a Sea Ice Scientist
summary: Linette Boisvert turned a childhood love of snow into a career as a sea ice scientist studying climate change. title: 15 Years Ago: Japan launches HTV-1, its First Resupply Mission to the Space Station
summary: On Sept. 10, 2009, the Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA) launched its first cargo delivery spacecraft, the H-II Transfer Vehicle-1 (HTV-1), to the International Space Station. The HTV cargo vehicles, also called Kounotori, meaning white stork in Japanese, not only maintained the Japanese Experiment Module Kibo but also resupplied the space station in general with […]

title: SpaceX launches Polaris Dawn, taking astronauts to heights not seen in decades
summary: SpaceX officially launched the Polaris Dawn mission, which lifted off from NASA’s Kennedy Space Center early on Tuesday morning. The mission is...

title: Sols 4300-4301: Rippled Pages
summary: Earth planning date: Monday, Sept. 9, 2024 With today’s plan, Curiosity completes its most southerly planned exploration of the Gediz Vallis channel. From here, our rover will head north and climb out of the channel to explore terrain to the west. Our planned drive to the “Tungsten Hills” rocks, named for a famous mining district […]

title: 30 Years Ago: STS-64 Astronauts Test a Spacewalk Rescue Aid
summary: On Sept. 9, 1994, space shuttle Discovery took to the skies on its 19th trip into space. During their 11-day mission, the STS-64 crew of Commander Richard “Dick” N. Richards, Pilot L. Blaine Hammond, and Mission Specialists Jerry M. Linenger, Susan J. Helms, Carl J. Meade, and Mark C. Lee demonstrated many of the space […]

title: Kyle Helson Finds EXCITE-ment in Exoplanet Exploration
summary: Almost a decade ago, then-grad student Kyle Helson contributed to early paperwork for NASA’s EXCITE mission. As a scientist at Goddard, Helson helped make this balloon-based telescope a reality: EXCITE launched successfully on Aug. 31. Name: Kyle HelsonTitle: Assistant Research ScientistOrganization: Observational Cosmology Lab (Code 665), via UMBC and the GESTAR II cooperative agreement with […]

title: Interlune reveals details of quest to bring home lunar resources
summary: SAN FRANCISCO – Without context, Interlune’s plan to extract Helium-3 from lunar regolith to fulfill terrestrial demand sounds improbable. Even Interlune co-founder and chief technology officer Gary Lai was skeptical […]

title: U.S. Space Force seeks industry input on automating hybrid satellite networks
summary: The Space Force's Commercial Satellite Communications Office issued a request for information on automated satcom network orchestration
